titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vicki Morris Photographs and Daily World Clippings TAM.448
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-07-22T10:37-0400

change.item: Edited by Bonnie Gordon to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: Vicki Morris Photographs and Daily World Clippings

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Vicki Morris was a reporter and editorilist for the Daily World as well as the daughter of George Morris, the Communist Party labor secretary. This small collection contains many clippings of articles and editorials of Morris's work as well as photographs of Morris.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Vicki Morris was a reporter and editorialist for the Communist Party, USA newspaper the Daily World (established 1968) and its successor, the People's Daily World, and the daughter of George Morris (1903-), an author, labor journalist, and the chair of the Labor Commission of the Communist Party, USA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains clippings of Vicki Morris's articles and editorials as well as photos of Morris.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Helen and George Morris, circa 1996. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.070.
